paragraph.paragraph: Many operations in EiffelStudio do not require the use of the mouse. The same effect can be achieved through the keyboard only.
This page gathers all the keyboard shortcuts available in the environment. They are sorted in several categories, depending on their domain of application.
paragraph.heading: 2Editor shortcuts
3Clipboard shortcuts

row.cell: Copy : Copy selected text into the clipboard.
Cut: Copy selected text into the clipboard and remove it.
Paste: Insert clipboard content into the text.

paragraph.heading: 3Undo/redo shortcuts
3Search shortcuts

row.cell: Display the Search tool and give the focus to the "Search for..." text field. This shortcut may be customized.
Display the Search tool and give the focus to the "Replace with..." text field. This shortcut may be customized.
Search the next occurrence of currently selected text or, if there is no selection, of the last searched expression. This shortcut may be customized.
Search the previous occurrence the last searched expression. This shortcut may be customized.

paragraph.heading: 3Shortcuts to modify selected text

row.cell: Indent selection (only if several lines are selected).
Unindent the selected lines or the current line if there is no selection.
Comment the selected lines or the current line if there is no selection.
Uncomment the selected lines or the current line if there is no selection. A line is uncommented only if '--' is at its beginning.
Embed selection (or the current line if there is no selection) in an "if...then...end" structure.
Embed selection (or the current line if there is no selection) in an "debug...end" structure.

paragraph.heading: 3Other shortcuts

row.cell: Auto-complete current word. This shortcut may be customized.

paragraph.note: Note: These shortcuts are not available everywhere. All operations that do not imply changes in the text are available both in the editor and in the class and feature tabs of the context tool. Other operations are available only in the editor.
paragraph.heading: 2Compiler

row.cell: Melt the system. This is the standard way to compile a debuggable system.
Melt classes that have been edited in EiffelStudio since the last compilation. This is the recommended way to compile a debuggable system as long as classes are not modified outside EiffelStudio.
Freeze the system. This melts the system and recompile the generated C code.
Finalize the system. This generates an optimized executable which is not debuggable.

paragraph.heading: 2Debugger

row.cell: Run. This is the standard way to run a system and debug it.
Run without breakpoints. Same as run except that breakpoints are ignored.

paragraph.heading: 2Miscellaneous
3File shortcuts

row.cell: Save the file currently edited in the editor.

paragraph.heading: 3Editor views shortcuts

row.cell: Display the text view in the editor.
Display the clickable view in the editor.
Display the flat view in the editor.
Display the contract view in the editor.
Display the flat contract view in the editor.
